001package com.telos.loops.events;
002
003import com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException;
004import com.telos.loops.internal.CoreSender;
005import com.telos.loops.internal.mappers.EventsMapper;
006import com.telos.loops.model.RequestOptions;
007import java.util.HashMap;
008import java.util.Map;
009import java.util.Objects;
010import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
011
012/**
013 * Client for sending events in Loops.
014 *
015 * <p>This client allows you to send events that trigger automated email campaigns. Events can
016 * include custom properties and support idempotency keys to prevent duplicate processing.
017 *
018 * <h2>Example Usage</h2>
019 *
020 * <pre>{@code
021 * LoopsClient client = LoopsClient.builder()
022 *         .apiKey("your-api-key")
023 *         .build();
024 *
025 * // Send an event
026 * Map<String, Object> eventProperties = new HashMap<>();
027 * eventProperties.put("productName", "Premium Plan");
028 * eventProperties.put("price", 99.99);
029 *
030 * EventSendRequest request = new EventSendRequest(
031 *     "purchase_completed",  // eventName
032 *     "user@example.com",  // email
033 *     null,  // userId (optional)
034 *     null,  // mailingLists
035 *     eventProperties  // custom event properties
036 * );
037 *
038 * EventResponse response = client.events().send(request);
039 *
040 * // Send with idempotency key to prevent duplicates
041 * String idempotencyKey = "order-123-event";
042 * EventResponse response2 = client.events().send(request, idempotencyKey);
043 *
044 * // Async example
045 * CompletableFuture<EventResponse> future =
046 *     client.events().sendAsync(request, idempotencyKey);
047 * }</pre>
048 *
049 * <p>All methods are available in both synchronous and asynchronous (CompletableFuture) variants.
050 *
051 * @see com.telos.loops.LoopsClient
052 */
053public class EventsClient {
054  private static final String SEND_PATH = "/events/send";
055  private static final int MAX_IDEMPOTENCY_KEY_LENGTH = 100;
056
057  private final CoreSender sender;
058
059  public EventsClient(CoreSender sender) {
060    this.sender = Objects.requireNonNull(sender);
061  }
062
063  // ============================================================
064  // Send Operations
065  // ============================================================
066
067  /**
068   * Sends an event to Loops.
069   *
070   * <p>This method uses default request options and no idempotency key.
071   *
072   * @param request the request object containing event details
073   * @return the response containing the event submission status
074   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
075   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
076   * @see #sendAsync(EventSendRequest) for the asynchronous variant
077   */
078  public EventResponse send(EventSendRequest request) {
079    return send(request, null, RequestOptions.none());
080  }
081
082  /**
083   * Sends an event to Loops with an idempotency key.
084   *
085   * <p>The idempotency key ensures that duplicate events are not processed if the same key is used
086   * within a certain time window.
087   *
088   * @param request the request object containing event details
089   * @param idempotencyKey optional idempotency key (max 100 characters) to prevent duplicate
090   *     processing
091   * @return the response containing the event submission status
092   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
093   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation or
094   *     idempotency key exceeds 100 characters
095   * @see #sendAsync(EventSendRequest, String) for the asynchronous variant
096   */
097  public EventResponse send(EventSendRequest request, String idempotencyKey) {
098    return send(request, idempotencyKey, RequestOptions.none());
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Sends an event to Loops with an idempotency key and custom request options.
103   *
104   * @param request the request object containing event details
105   * @param idempotencyKey optional idempotency key (max 100 characters) to prevent duplicate
106   *     processing
107   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
108   * @return the response containing the event submission status
109   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
110   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation or
111   *     idempotency key exceeds 100 characters
112   * @see #sendAsync(EventSendRequest, String, RequestOptions) for the asynchronous variant
113   */
114  public EventResponse send(
115      EventSendRequest request, String idempotencyKey, RequestOptions options) {
116    validateIdempotencyKey(idempotencyKey);
117
118    var generatedRequest = EventsMapper.toGenerated(request);
119    var optionsWithIdempotency = addIdempotencyKey(options, idempotencyKey);
120
121    var generatedResponse =
122        sender.postJson(
123            SEND_PATH,
124            generatedRequest,
125            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.EventSuccessResponse.class,
126            optionsWithIdempotency);
127    return EventsMapper.fromGenerated(generatedResponse);
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Asynchronously sends an event to Loops.
132   *
133   * <p>This method uses default request options and no idempotency key.
134   *
135   * @param request the request object containing event details
136   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the event submission status
137   * @see #send(EventSendRequest) for the synchronous variant
138   */
139  public CompletableFuture<EventResponse> sendAsync(EventSendRequest request) {
140    return sendAsync(request, null, RequestOptions.none());
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Asynchronously sends an event to Loops with an idempotency key.
145   *
146   * <p>The idempotency key ensures that duplicate events are not processed if the same key is used
147   * within a certain time window.
148   *
149   * @param request the request object containing event details
150   * @param idempotencyKey optional idempotency key (max 100 characters) to prevent duplicate
151   *     processing
152   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the event submission status
153   * @see #send(EventSendRequest, String) for the synchronous variant
154   */
155  public CompletableFuture<EventResponse> sendAsync(
156      EventSendRequest request, String idempotencyKey) {
157    return sendAsync(request, idempotencyKey, RequestOptions.none());
158  }
159
160  /**
161   * Asynchronously sends an event to Loops with an idempotency key and custom request options.
162   *
163   * @param request the request object containing event details
164   * @param idempotencyKey optional idempotency key (max 100 characters) to prevent duplicate
165   *     processing
166   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
167   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the event submission status
168   * @see #send(EventSendRequest, String, RequestOptions) for the synchronous variant
169   */
170  public CompletableFuture<EventResponse> sendAsync(
171      EventSendRequest request, String idempotencyKey, RequestOptions options) {
172    validateIdempotencyKey(idempotencyKey);
173
174    var generatedRequest = EventsMapper.toGenerated(request);
175    var optionsWithIdempotency = addIdempotencyKey(options, idempotencyKey);
176
177    return sender
178        .postJsonAsync(
179            SEND_PATH,
180            generatedRequest,
181            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.EventSuccessResponse.class,
182            optionsWithIdempotency)
183        .thenApply(EventsMapper::fromGenerated);
184  }
185
186  // ============================================================
187  // Helper Methods
188  // ============================================================
189
190  private void validateIdempotencyKey(String idempotencyKey) {
191    if (idempotencyKey != null && idempotencyKey.length() > MAX_IDEMPOTENCY_KEY_LENGTH) {
192      throw new LoopsValidationException(
193          "Idempotency key must not exceed "
194              + MAX_IDEMPOTENCY_KEY_LENGTH
195              + " characters, got: "
196              + idempotencyKey.length());
197    }
198  }
199
200  private RequestOptions addIdempotencyKey(RequestOptions options, String idempotencyKey) {
201    if (idempotencyKey == null) {
202      return options;
203    }
204
205    Map<String, String> headers = new HashMap<>(options.headers());
206    headers.put("Idempotency-Key", idempotencyKey);
207    return new RequestOptions(headers);
208  }
209}
